mysql

Interface DBIgui

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DBgui

    public interface DBIgui
    interface for modifying some data from a database (with restrictions)
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Maximilian Awiszus, Holger Ebhart

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getCategories

        Category getCategories()
        Get all categories from db.
        Returns:
        all categories, null if an error occurred.

      • getLocations

        java.util.List<Location> getLocations()
        Get all locations from db.
        Returns:
        a list of locations.

      • getAccountId

        int getAccountId(java.lang.String accountName)
        Get id of account with accountName.
        Parameters:
        accountName - of the twitter account.
        Returns:
        id of the account or -1 if not found.

      • getAllRetweetsPerLocation

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getAllRetweetsPerLocation()
        returns the sum of all retweets for each location
        Returns:
        the sum of all retweets for each location (the location as locationCode in the hashmap as key) as HashMap

      • getAllData

        java.util.List<Account> getAllData(java.lang.Integer[] categoryIDs,
                                 java.lang.Integer[] locationIDs,
                                 java.lang.Integer[] accountIDs,
                                 boolean byDates)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                          java.sql.SQLException
        returns all accounts that match a category- and a location-ID, with the associated total-number of Tweets and Retweets
        Parameters:
        categoryIDs - the ids of the selected categorys as Integer[]
        locationIDs - the ids of the selected locations as Integer[]
        accountIDs - the ids of the additional accounts as Integer[]
        byDates - false if the data should be aggregated over days, if not true
        Returns:
        all accounts that match a category- and a location-ID, with the associated total-number of Tweets and Retweets as List
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if categoryIDs or/and LocationIDs is empty or null
        java.sql.SQLException - thrown if the sql-query couldn't be built

      • getSumOfData

        TweetsAndRetweets getSumOfData(java.lang.Integer[] categoryIDs,
                             java.lang.Integer[] locationIDs,
                             java.lang.Integer[] accountIDs,
                             boolean byDates)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                      java.sql.SQLException
        returns the total number of tweets and retweets from all the accounts that match a category- and a location-ID per location
        Parameters:
        categoryIDs - the ids of the selected categorys as Integer[]
        locationIDs - the ids of the selected locations as Integer[]
        accountIDs - the ids of the additional accounts as Integer[]
        byDates - false if the data should be aggregated over days, if not true
        Returns:
        the total number of tweets and retweets from all the accounts that match a category- and a location-ID per location as TweetsAndRetweets
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if categoryIDs or/and LocationIDs is empty or null
        java.sql.SQLException - thrown if the sql-query couldn't be built

      • getAllDataWithDates

        java.util.List<Account> getAllDataWithDates(java.lang.Integer[] categoryIDs,
                                          java.lang.Integer[] locationIDs,
                                          java.lang.Integer[] accountIDs)
                                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                   java.sql.SQLException
        Deprecated. use getAllData and set byDates on true
        returns all accounts that match a category- and a location-ID, with the associated number of Tweets and Retweets per Day
        Parameters:
        categoryIDs - the ids of the selected categorys as int[]
        locationIDs - the ids of the selected locations as int[]
        accountIDs - the ids of the additional accounts as int[]
        Returns:
        all accounts that match a category- and a location-ID, with the associated number of Tweets and Retweets per Day as List
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if categoryIDs or/and LocationIDs is empty or null
        java.sql.SQLException - thrown if the sql-query couldn't be built

      • getSumOfDataWithDates

        TweetsAndRetweets getSumOfDataWithDates(java.lang.Integer[] categoryIDs,
                                      java.lang.Integer[] locationIDs,
                                      java.lang.Integer[] accountIDs)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                               java.sql.SQLException
        Deprecated. use getSumOfData and set byDates on true
        returns the total number of tweets and retweets from all the accounts that match a category- and a location-ID per location per day
        Parameters:
        categoryIDs - the ids of the selected categorys as int[]
        locationIDs - the ids of the selected locations as int[]
        accountIDs - the ids of the additional accounts as int[]
        Returns:
        the total number of tweets and retweets from all the accounts that match a category- and a location-ID per location per Day as TweetsAndRetweets
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if categoryIDs or/and LocationIDs is empty or null
        java.sql.SQLException - thrown if the sql-query couldn't be built

      • getAccounts

        java.util.List<Account> getAccounts(java.lang.String search)
        Return list of accounts which name contains search
        Parameters:
        search - the word to search as String
        Returns:
        a list of accounts (Limit 50, no tweets, retweets and categories), on fault return null.

      • addAccount

        boolean addAccount(twitter4j.User user,
                 int locationID)
        Add a new account to db.
        Parameters:
        user - the twitter-user to add as User
        locationID - the locationID of the TwitterUser as int (has to reference a guilty location in the database)
        Returns:
        true if successful

      • setCategory

        boolean setCategory(int accountID,
                  int categoryID)
        Change category of an account.
        Parameters:
        accountID - of an account
        categoryID - of a category
        Returns:
        true on success

      • setLocation

        boolean setLocation(int accountId,
                  int locationId)
        Add or remove a location from an account.
        Parameters:
        accountId - of the account
        locationId - of the location
        Returns:
        true on success
